benchmark_details.name: SPORTU (SPORT Understanding Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: SPORTU is a comprehensive benchmark designed to assess Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) across multi-level sports reasoning tasks, comprising two components: SPORTU-text for text-based question answering and SPORTU-video for video-based question answering.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the sports understanding capabilities of MLLMs across text and video-based tasks, focusing on deep reasoning and rule-based understanding in sports.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The models showed significant challenges in handling complex reasoning and rule comprehension, particularly in tasks requiring deep sports knowledge.

data.source: SPORTU-text and SPORTU-video datasets generated and annotated by sports experts.
data.size: 900 multiple-choice questions, 1,701 slow-motion video clips, 12,048 QA pairs

methodology.calculation: Accuracy metrics are based on the comparison of model predictions against ground truth labels.
methodology.interpretation: The evaluation metrics help assess model performance in terms of accuracy and reasoning quality for sports understanding.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4o achieved the highest accuracy at 71% on SPORTU-text.
methodology.validation: A rigorous quality verification process ensured accuracy and consistency of annotations.
